etymologies: mid 18th century: perhaps from Algonquian cau'-cau'-as'u ‘adviser’

definitions: (in some US states) a meeting at which local members of a political party register their preference among candidates running for office or select delegates to attend a convention

examples.text: Hawaii holds its nominating caucuses next Tuesday
he stumbled through the Iowa caucuses and the New Hampshire primary

shortDefinitions: meeting at which local members of party express preference for presidential candidate

definitions: a conference of members of a legislative body who belong to a particular party or faction

examples.text: Mr. Kerry attended the morning caucus in the Old Senate Chamber where his fellow Democrats selected the new minority leadership

shortDefinitions: conference of members of legislative body who belong to particular political party or faction

definitions: the members of a legislative body who belong to a particular party or faction, considered as a group

examples.text: he expected that 50 to 60 Republicans would join a united Democratic caucus in voting for a resolution condemning the idea

shortDefinitions: members of legislative body who belong to party

definitions: an informal group composed of legislators who have shared concerns or interests

examples.text: a member of the Congressional Black Caucus

shortDefinitions: group of people with shared concerns within political party

definitions: a group within an organization or political party which meets independently to discuss strategy or tactics

examples.text: up to fifty caucuses met daily on conference grounds to discuss lobbying strategies
he was forced out by a hard-left caucus which had taken over his constituency party

shortDefinitions: group within organization which meets independently

definitions: hold or form a legislative caucus

examples.text: there is one Independent who caucuses with the Democrats

definitions: (of a voter) attend an electoral caucus, especially on behalf of a particular candidate

examples.text: more than half of those young people that caucused yesterday caucused for Barack Obama
